title.narrative: Empowering Girls with Disabilities in Uganda through Education

description.narrative: At outcome level, the project aims to achieve; Improvement in literacy and numeracy learning outcomes of girls with disabilities in Kampala: Improvement in transition rates of girls with disabilities in Kampala and: Demontsrate that the changes it has brought about which increase learning and transition through education cycles are sustainable: Performance against comprehensive sustainability scorecard (scores 1-4). At intermediate outcome level, the project seeks to improve; school attendance of girls with disabilities, inclusive teaching practices among teachers, self- esteem & agency among the girls with disabilities, ability of parents to support education of girls with disabilities and also the school, household, policy, system environment to support the needs of girls with disabilities.

The project supports education of girls with disabilities in a holistic way by; providing direct education support to contribute to retention in schools to learn: Supporting schools with disability accessible facilities and Resource centers to improve the teaching-learning process: Capacity building on disability and inclusive education among teachers to facilitate teaching and learning process in a gender and disability inclusive setting: Training the parents and caregivers on income generation, disability and gender and how these influence education for their daughters and: Sensitising Schools, Community, system stakeholders on disability, gender and inclusive education to promote education of girls with disabilities.

participating-org.narrative: Girls’ Education Challenge – Fund Manager PwC

title.narrative: Learning outcome
Number of disabled girls supported by GEC (disaggregated by impairment type) demonstrating SD 0.25 literacy outcome improvement at each evaluation point.

description.narrative: Literacy outcome improvement assessed using EGRA/SeGRA

comment.narrative: These are the means of the learners Literacy performance averaged from primary grade 3 to Secondary 3 across disability at Baseline as calculated and presented in the learning outcomes. A SD in literacy improvement shall be computed for future evaluation points
No new data yet

title.narrative: Number of disabled girls supported by GEC (disaggregated by impairment type) demonstrating SD 0.25 Numeracy outcome improvement at each evaluation point.

description.narrative: Numeracy outcome improvement assessed using EGMA/SeGMA

comment.narrative: These are the means of the learners Numeracy performance averaged from primary grade 3 to Secondary 3 across disability at Baseline as calculated and presented in the learning outcomes. An SD in numeracy improvement shall be computed for future evaluation points
No new data yet

title.narrative: School Attendance outcome
Stakeholders` views on the extent to which project interventions (Infrastructure, Economic support and Teacher quality) have contributed to school attendance of disabled girls.

description.narrative: Measured on a scale of 1-3 (1-Not at all, 2-Small extent, 3-Great extent)

comment.narrative: 94% of the caregivers/parents believed to a great extent that the project interventions were contributing to attendance of their daughters with disability

title.narrative: % improvement in disabled girls' attendance in schools (disaggregated by impairment type) throughout the life of the project

comment.narrative: No new campaigns held. Activity stopped.
